glsa.title: Aircrack-ng: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Aircrack-ng contains a buffer overflow that could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.

background.p: Aircrack-ng is an 802.11 WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program that can recover keys once enough data packets have been captured.

description.p: Jonathan So reported that the airodump-ng module does not correctly check the size of 802.11 authentication packets before copying them into a buffer.

impact.p: A remote attacker could trigger a stack-based buffer overflow by sending a specially crafted 802.11 authentication packet to a user running airodump-ng with the -w (--write) option. This could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running airodump-ng, which is typically the root user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
